items.summary: Redesign the Seller Dashboard page UI (frontend/src/pages/SellerDashboardPage.tsx) to closely match the layout, spacing, and visual hierarchy of the two uploaded Shopify admin mobile screenshots, while allowing small visual differences and keeping all user-facing text in English.

Implement a Shopify-admin-like top header section within the Seller Dashboard content (not the global app Header) that matches the screenshots: a dark bar with a menu icon, a prominent search input, a notifications icon, and a circular user/store badge placeholder. This header must not change global navigation behavior outside the dashboard.

Update the Seller Dashboard main content to follow the screenshot’s onboarding/checklist card pattern (e.g., ‘Add store name’, ‘Add your first product’, and additional setup cards), wiring CTAs to existing app actions: store name/settings must navigate to /create-store, and ‘Add product’ must open the existing ProductFormDialog. Any additional setup cards may be informational-only if no corresponding feature exists, but must look consistent and not break navigation.
Ensure the Seller Dashboard contains no visible occurrences of the brand name ‘Shopify’; replace any such visible copy with ‘Shanju’ where branding is needed. Keep all user-facing text in English.
